availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Dudley Messick (Bath County, Kentucky, day laborer)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, day laborer. Kentucky laborer. Day laborer in Bath County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in 24th Regiment Kentucky Infantry as Private/Musician from October 9, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 3.
Find A Grave, "Dudley M. Messick (Jan. 24, 1840-Mar. 6, 1890)," Memorial #110556219, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/110556219 (accessed April 1, 2020).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
